item.description:
We have a special event planned for our May meetup.  Inspired by both the Designers' Lounge at the 2010 Permaculture Convergence and by our friends in the broader design world, "Perma Kulcha" is a fun, social way to share and see permaculture designs.  Any permaculture designer or PDC grad is welcome to "pin up" an example of their work (email LisaF to get on the roster) and, if interested, give a short (400 seconds) presentation of their design style and specialty areas.

Location:  PelotonLabs, Portland's newest co-working space in Bramhall Square.

6:30 Potluck Refreshments (bring a drink or snack to share + your own utensils)

7:00 Announcements & Recognition of Designers

7:30 Short Talks by Designers Who Would Like to Talk...

Open to anyone interested in learning about permaculture and the design process.  Designers and PDC grads, please plan to arrive around 6pm to pin up.
item.how_to_find_us: Obvious new building in Bramhall Square!
item.why: Design is at the core of permaculture; this is a fun & social way to share ideas, understand/see designs and get inspired in your own practice or for your own property! Open to all permaculture designers & anyone interested in sustainable design.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Perma Kulcha: A Designers' Lounge for Maine Permaculture Designers & Friends
